info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Albany NY
info.description:
At 815 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Little Falls, moving east at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Ingham Mills, Meco, Cook Corners, Fultonville, Johnstown, Jordanville, Mindenville, Davys Corners, Fical Corners, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Hale Mills, Ripple Corners, McKinley, Phipps Corners, Ingham Mills Station, West Saint Johnsville, Bleecker Center, Sand Hill, Wrights Corners, and Nelliston.
This includes Interstate 90 between exits 28 and 29A.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
